basics.name: Anthony Gonzales
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer at Compass, Inc.
basics.summary:
Hands on developer with proven experience in building scalable and performant
web interfaces for some of the world’s most recognized brands. I work methodically,
craft innovative solutions, and participate in every part of the product life
cycle.

work.summary:
Tech lead on an in house search project called Agent Search. I led standards
and best practices on the front-end team that launched a redesign and development
effort of search for Compass's real estate agents. This project made use of the
previous MLS Filters project and integrated with several other teams to create
efficient workflows for customers.

Lead front-end development for Compass's MLS Filters project as Tech Lead.
I worked with a team of developers to architect a dynamic React form system to
perform MLS specific queries. I mentored junior developers and team members on
Test Driven Development best practices and standards. Our team utilized Jest,
React Testing Library, and Cypress for testing to maintain code quality and reliability.

Lead front-end development for Compass's CRM application Contacts as Tech
Lead. I worked with a team of developers to architect a React application with
Redux, Redux Sagas, and React Router. I mentored junior developers and team members
on Test Driven Development best practices and standards. Our team utilized Jest
and Enzyme for unit testing and an in-house end-to-end test framework to maintain
code quality and reliability.

Developed and lead front-end best practices for Glossier.com, an e-commerce
beauty website built on Solidus and Ruby on Rails. Added front-end unit testing
as part of the development process. Lead migration from Angular monolith to React
components.

Managed a team of front-end engineers across all projects. I collaborated
cross-functionally with project managers and stakeholders to project estimates
and deadlines. I conducted front-end audits and created benchmarks to provide
customer insights.

Built reproducible best practices for templating, CSS styling, and JS interactions.
Led code reviews on Github to ensure proper coding practices were followed.

awards.title: Site of the Year Award 2015: Mint.com
awards.summary:
Acquia’s digital agency partners submitted client sites for consideration
across various categories. A small committee selected 16 winning projects from
48 finalists, evaluating each site’s visual design, functionality, integration
and overall customer experience to identify the winners in each category. Third
and Grove was selected for an award in the Financial Services category for Mint.com,
of which I was a front-end architect and engineer.
